segment_text: Craphound had wicked yard-sale karma, for a rotten, filthy alien bastard.
scene_description: Conceptual, abstract background, soft flowing colors, dreamy atmosphere.

segment_text: He was too good at panning out the single grain of gold in a raging river of uselessness for me not to like him -- respect him, anyway.
scene_description: Conceptual, abstract background, soft flowing colors, dreamy atmosphere.

segment_text: But then he found the cowboy trunk.
scene_description: Conceptual, abstract background, soft flowing colors, dreamy atmosphere.

segment_text: It was two months' rent to me and nothing but some squirrelly alien kitsch-fetish to Craphound.
scene_description: Conceptual, abstract background, soft flowing colors, dreamy atmosphere.

segment_text: So I did the unthinkable. I violated the Code.
scene_description: Conceptual, abstract background, soft flowing colors, dreamy atmosphere.

segment_text: I got into a bidding war with a buddy.
scene_description: Conceptual, abstract background, soft flowing colors, dreamy atmosphere.

segment_text: Never let them tell you that women poison friendships: in my experience, wounds from women-fights heal quickly; fights over garbage leave nothing behind but scorched earth.
scene_description: Conceptual, abstract background, soft flowing colors, dreamy atmosphere.

segment_text: Craphound spotted the sign -- his karma, plus the goggles in his exoskeleton, gave him the advantage when we were doing 80 kmh on some stretch of back-highway in cottage country.
scene_description: Outdoors, highway asphalt, roadside trees, summer sky.

segment_text: He was riding shotgun while I drove, and we had the radio on to the CBC's summer-Saturday programming: eight weekends with eight hours of old radio dramas: "The Shadow," "Quiet Please," "Tom Mix," "The Crypt-Keeper" with Bela Lugosi.
scene_description: Outdoors, highway asphalt, roadside trees, summer sky.

segment_text: It was hour three, and Bogey was phoning in his performance on a radio adaptation of _The African Queen_.
scene_description: Outdoors, highway asphalt, roadside trees, summer sky.

segment_text: I had the windows of the old truck rolled down so that I could smoke without fouling Craphound's breather.
scene_description: Outdoors, highway asphalt, roadside trees, summer sky.

segment_text: My arm was hanging out the window, the radio was booming, and Craphound said "Turn around! Turn around, now, Jerry, now, turn around!"
scene_description: Outdoors, highway asphalt, roadside trees, summer sky.

segment_text: When Craphound gets that excited, it's a sign that he's spotted a rich vein.
scene_description: Outdoors, highway asphalt, roadside trees, summer sky.

segment_text: I checked the side-mirror quickly, pounded the brakes and spun around.
scene_description: Outdoors, highway asphalt, roadside trees, summer sky.

segment_text: The transmission creaked, the wheels squealed, and then we were creeping along the way we'd come.
scene_description: Outdoors, highway asphalt, roadside trees, summer sky.

segment_text: "There," Craphound said, gesturing with his long, skinny arm. I saw it.
scene_description: Outdoors, dirt roadside, wooden A-frame sign, distant trees.

segment_text: A wooden A-frame real-estate sign, a piece of hand-lettered cardboard stuck overtop of the realtor's name: EAST MUSKOKA VOLUNTEER FIRE-DEPT LADIES AUXILIARY RUMMAGE SALE SAT 25 JUNE
scene_description: Outdoors, dirt roadside, wooden A-frame sign, distant trees.

segment_text: "Hoo-eee!" I hollered, and spun the truck onto the dirt road.
scene_description: Outdoors, dirt roadside, wooden A-frame sign, distant trees.

segment_text: I gunned the engine as we cruised along the tree-lined road, trusting Craphound to spot any deer, signs, or hikers in time to avert disaster.
scene_description: Outdoors, dirt roadside, wooden A-frame sign, distant trees.

segment_text: The sky was a perfect blue and the smells of summer were all around us.
scene_description: Outdoors, dirt roadside, wooden A-frame sign, distant trees.

segment_text: I snapped off the radio and listened to the wind rushing through the truck. Ontario is _beautiful_ in the summer.
scene_description: Outdoors, dirt roadside, wooden A-frame sign, distant trees.

segment_text: "There!" Craphound shouted. I hit the turn-off and down-shifted and then we were back on a paved road.
scene_description: Outdoors, dirt roadside, wooden A-frame sign, distant trees.

segment_text: Soon, we were rolling into a country fire-station, an ugly brick barn.
scene_description: Outdoors, brick barn building, gravel driveway, folding card-table.

segment_text: The hall was lined with long, folding tables, stacked high. The mother lode!
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: Craphound beat me out the door, as usual.
scene_description: Outdoors, brick barn building, gravel driveway, folding card-table.

segment_text: His exoskeleton is programmable, so he can record little scripts for it like: move left arm to door handle, pop it, swing legs out to running-board, jump to ground, close door, move forward.
scene_description: Outdoors, brick barn building, gravel driveway, folding card-table.

segment_text: Meanwhile, I'm still making sure I've switched off the headlights and that I've got my wallet.
scene_description: Outdoors, brick barn building, gravel driveway, folding card-table.

segment_text: Two blue-haired grannies had a card-table set up out front of the hall, with a big tin pitcher of lemonade and three boxes of Tim Horton assorted donuts.
scene_description: Outdoors, brick barn building, gravel driveway, folding card-table.

segment_text: That stopped us both, since we share the superstition that you _always_ buy food from old ladies and little kids, as a sacrifice to the crap-gods.
scene_description: Outdoors, brick barn building, gravel driveway, folding card-table.

segment_text: One of the old ladies poured out the lemonade while the other smiled and greeted us.
scene_description: Outdoors, brick barn building, gravel driveway, folding card-table.

segment_text: "Welcome, welcome! My, you've come a long way for us!"
scene_description: Outdoors, brick barn building, gravel driveway, folding card-table.

segment_text: "Just up from Toronto, ma'am," I said. It's an old joke, but it's also part of the ritual, and it's got to be done.
scene_description: Outdoors, brick barn building, gravel driveway, folding card-table.

segment_text: "I meant your friend, sir. This gentleman."
scene_description: Outdoors, brick barn building, gravel driveway, folding card-table.

segment_text: Craphound smiled without baring his gums and sipped his lemonade. "Of course I came, dear lady. I wouldn't miss it for the worlds!"
scene_description: Outdoors, brick barn building, gravel driveway, folding card-table.

segment_text: His accent is pretty good, but when it comes to stock phrases like this, he's got so much polish you'd think he was reading the news.
scene_description: Outdoors, brick barn building, gravel driveway, folding card-table.

segment_text: The biddie _blushed_ and _giggled_, and I felt faintly sick.
scene_description: Outdoors, brick barn building, gravel driveway, folding card-table.

segment_text: I walked off to the tables, trying not to hurry.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: I chose my first spot, about halfway down, where things wouldn't be quite so picked-over.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: I grabbed an empty box from underneath and started putting stuff into it: four matched highball glasses with gold crossed bowling-pins and a line of black around the rim; an Expo '67 wall-hanging that wasn't even a little faded; a shoebox full of late sixties O-Pee-Chee hockey cards; a worn, wooden-handled steel cleaver that you could butcher a steer with.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: I picked up my box and moved on: a deck of playing cards copyrighted '57, with the logo for the Royal Canadian Dairy, Bala Ontario printed on the backs; a fireman's cap with a brass badge so tarnished I couldn't read it; a three-story wedding-cake trophy for the 1974 Eastern Region Curling Championships.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: The cash-register in my mind was ringing, ringing, ringing. God bless the East Muskoka Volunteer Fire Department Ladies' Auxiliary.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: I'd mined that table long enough. I moved to the other end of the hall.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: Time was, I'd start at the beginning and turn over each item, build one pile of maybes and another pile of definites, try to strategise.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: In time, I came to rely on instinct and on the fates, to whom I make my obeisances at every opportunity.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: Let's hear it for the fates: a genuine collapsible top-hat; a white-tipped evening cane; a hand-carved cherry-wood walking stick; a beautiful black lace parasol; a wrought-iron lightning rod with a rooster on top; all of it in an elephant-leg umbrella-stand.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: I filled the box, folded it over, and started on another.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: I collided with Craphound. He grinned his natural grin, the one that showed row on row of wet, slimy gums, tipped with writhing, poisonous suckers.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: "Gold! Gold!" he said, and moved along. I turned my head after him, just as he bent over the cowboy trunk.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: I sucked air between my teeth. It was magnificent: a leather-bound miniature steamer trunk, the leather worked with lariats, Stetson hats, war-bonnets and six-guns.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: I moved toward him, and he popped the latch. I caught my breath.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: On top, there was a kid's cowboy costume: miniature leather chaps, a tiny Stetson, a pair of scuffed white-leather cowboy boots with long, worn spurs affixed to the heels.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: Craphound moved it reverently to the table and continued to pull more magic from the trunk's depths: a stack of cardboard-bound Hopalong Cassidy 78s; a pair of tin six-guns with gunbelt and holsters; a silver star that said Sheriff; a bundle of Roy Rogers comics tied with twine, in mint condition; and a leather satchel filled with plastic cowboys and Indians, enough to re-enact the Alamo.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: "Oh, my God," I breathed, as he spread the loot out on the table.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: "What are these, Jerry?" Craphound asked, holding up the 78s.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: "Old records, like LPs, but you need a special record player to listen to them." I took one out of its sleeve.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: It gleamed, scratch-free, in the overhead fluorescents.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: "I got a 78 player here," said a member of the East Muskoka Volunteer Fire Department Ladies' Auxiliary.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: She was short enough to look Craphound in the eye, a hair under five feet, and had a skinny, rawboned look to her.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: "That's my Billy's things, Billy the Kid we called him. He was dotty for cowboys when he was a boy.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: Couldn't get him to take off that fool outfit -- nearly got him thrown out of school. He's a lawyer now, in Toronto, got a fancy office on Bay Street.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: I called him to ask if he minded my putting his cowboy things in the sale, and you know what? He didn't know what I was talking about!
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: Doesn't that beat everything? He was dotty for cowboys when he was a boy."
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: It's another of my rituals to smile and nod and be as polite as possible to the erstwhile owners of crap that I'm trying to buy, so I smiled and nodded and examined the 78 player she had produced.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: In lariat script, on the top, it said, "Official Bob Wills Little Record Player," and had a crude watercolour of Bob Wills and His Texas Playboys grinning on the front.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: It was the kind of record player that folded up like a suitcase when you weren't using it. I'd had one as a kid, with Yogi Bear silkscreened on the front.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: Billy's mom plugged the yellowed cord into a wall jack and took the 78 from me, touched the stylus to the record.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: A tinny ukelele played, accompanied by horse-clops, and then a narrator with a deep, whisky voice said, "Howdy, Pardners! I was just settin' down by the ole campfire. Why don't you stay an' have some beans, an' I'll tell y'all the story of how Hopalong Cassidy beat the Duke Gang when they come to rob the Santa Fe."
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: In my head, I was already breaking down the cowboy trunk and its contents, thinking about the minimum bid I'd place on each item at Sotheby's.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: Sold individually, I figured I could get over two grand for the contents.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: Then I thought about putting ads in some of the Japanese collectors' magazines, just for a lark, before I sent the lot to the auction house. You never can tell.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: A buddy I knew had sold a complete packaged set of Welcome Back, Kotter action figures for nearly eight grand that way. Maybe I could buy a new truck. . .
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: "This is wonderful," Craphound said, interrupting my reverie. "How much would you like for the collection?"
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: I felt a knife in my guts. Craphound had found the cowboy trunk, so that meant it was his.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: But he usually let me take the stuff with street-value -- he was interested in _everything_, so it hardly mattered if I picked up a few scraps with which to eke out a living.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: Billy's mom looked over the stuff. "I was hoping to get twenty dollars for the lot, but if that's too much, I'm willing to come down."
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: "I'll give you thirty," my mouth said, without intervention from my brain.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: They both turned and stared at me. Craphound was unreadable behind his goggles.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: Billy's mom broke the silence. "Oh, my! Thirty dollars for this old mess?"
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: "I will pay fifty," Craphound said.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: "Seventy-five," I said.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: "Oh, my," Billy's mom said.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: "Five hundred," Craphound said.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: I opened my mouth, and shut it. Craphound had built his stake on Earth by selling a complicated biochemical process for non-chlorophyll photosynthesis to a Saudi banker.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: I wouldn't ever beat him in a bidding war. "A thousand dollars," my mouth said.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: "Ten thousand," Craphound said, and extruded a roll of hundreds from somewhere in his exoskeleton.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: "My Lord!" Billy's mom said. "Ten thousand dollars!"
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: The other pickers, the firemen, the blue haired ladies all looked up at that and stared at us, their mouths open.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: "It is for a good cause." Craphound said.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: "Ten thousand dollars!" Billy's mom said again.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: Craphound's digits ruffled through the roll as fast as a croupier's counter, separated off a large chunk of the brown bills, and handed them to Billy's mom.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: One of the firemen, a middle-aged paunchy man with a comb-over appeared at Billy's mom's shoulder.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: "What's going on, Eva?" he said.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: "This. . .gentleman is going to pay ten thousand dollars for Billy's old cowboy things, Tom."
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: The fireman took the money from Billy's mom and stared at it.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: He held up the top note under the light and turned it this way and that, watching the holographic stamp change from green to gold, then green again.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: He looked at the serial number, then the serial number of the next bill. He licked his forefinger and started counting off the bills in piles of ten.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: Once he had ten piles, he counted them again. "That's ten thousand dollars, all right. Thank you very much, mister.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: Can I give you a hand getting this to your car?"
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: Craphound, meanwhile, had re-packed the trunk and balanced the 78 player on top of it. He looked at me, then at the fireman.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: "I wonder if I could impose on you to take me to the nearest bus station. I think I'm going to be making my own way home."
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: The fireman and Billy's mom both stared at me. My cheeks flushed.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: "Aw, c'mon," I said. "I'll drive you home."
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: "I think I prefer the bus," Craphound said.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: "It's no trouble at all to give you a lift, friend," the fireman said.
scene_description: Indoors, large hall, long folding tables, piled rummage items.

segment_text: I called it quits for the day, and drove home alone with the truck only half-filled.
scene_description: Indoors, living room, comfortable sofa, glowing television screen.

segment_text: I pulled it into the coach-house and threw a tarp over the load and went inside and cracked a beer and sat on the sofa, watching a nature show on a desert reclamation project in Arizona, where the state legislature had traded a derelict mega-mall and a custom-built habitat to an alien for a local-area weather control machine.
scene_description: Indoors, living room, comfortable sofa, glowing television screen.

segment_text: The following Thursday, I went to the little crap-auction house on King Street.
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: I'd put my finds from the weekend in the sale: lower minimum bid, and they took a smaller commission than Sotheby's. Fine for moving the small stuff.
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: Craphound was there, of course. I knew he'd be.
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: It was where we met, when he bid on a case of Lincoln Logs I'd found at a fire-sale.
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: I'd known him for a kindred spirit when he bought them, and we'd talked afterwards, at his place, a sprawling, two-storey warehouse amid a cluster of auto-wrecking yards where the junkyard dogs barked, barked, barked.
scene_description: Indoors, vast warehouse, eclectic furniture arrangements, distinct themed zones.

segment_text: Inside was paradise.
scene_description: Indoors, vast warehouse, eclectic furniture arrangements, distinct themed zones.

segment_text: His taste ran to shrines -- a collection of fifties bar kitsch that was a shrine to liquor; a circular waterbed on a raised podium that was nearly buried under seventies bachelor pad-inalia; a kitchen that was nearly unusable, so packed it was with old barn-board furniture and rural memorabilia; a leather-appointed library straight out of a Victorian gentlemen's club; a solarium dressed in wicker and bamboo and tiki-idols.
scene_description: Indoors, vast warehouse, eclectic furniture arrangements, distinct themed zones.

segment_text: It was a hell of a place.
scene_description: Indoors, vast warehouse, eclectic furniture arrangements, distinct themed zones.

segment_text: Craphound had known all about the Goodwills and the Sally Anns, and the auction houses, and the kitsch boutiques on Queen Street, but he still hadn't figured out where it all came from.
scene_description: Indoors, vast warehouse, eclectic furniture arrangements, distinct themed zones.

segment_text: "Yard sales, rummage sales, garage sales," I said, reclining in a vibrating naughahyde easy-chair, drinking a glass of his pricey single-malt that he'd bought for the beautiful bottle it came in.
scene_description: Indoors, vast warehouse, eclectic furniture arrangements, distinct themed zones.

segment_text: "But where are these? Who is allowed to make them?" Craphound hunched opposite me, his exoskeleton locked into a coiled, semi-seated position.
scene_description: Indoors, vast warehouse, eclectic furniture arrangements, distinct themed zones.

segment_text: "Who? Well, anyone. You just one day decide that you need to clean out the basement, you put an ad in the _Star_, tape up a few signs, and voila, yard sale.
scene_description: Indoors, vast warehouse, eclectic furniture arrangements, distinct themed zones.

segment_text: Sometimes, a school or a church will get donations of old junk and sell it all at one time, as a fundraiser."
scene_description: Indoors, vast warehouse, eclectic furniture arrangements, distinct themed zones.

segment_text: "And how do you locate these?" he asked, bobbing up and down slightly with excitement.
scene_description: Indoors, vast warehouse, eclectic furniture arrangements, distinct themed zones.

segment_text: "Well, there're amateurs who just read the ads in the weekend papers, or just pick a neighbourhood and wander around, but that's no way to go about it.
scene_description: Indoors, vast warehouse, eclectic furniture arrangements, distinct themed zones.

segment_text: What I do is, I get in a truck, and I sniff the air, catch the scent of crap and _vroom!_, I'm off like a bloodhound on a trail.
scene_description: Indoors, vast warehouse, eclectic furniture arrangements, distinct themed zones.

segment_text: You learn things over time: like stay away from Yuppie yard sales, they never have anything worth buying, just the same crap you can buy in any mall."
scene_description: Indoors, vast warehouse, eclectic furniture arrangements, distinct themed zones.

segment_text: "Do you think I might accompany you some day?"
scene_description: Indoors, vast warehouse, eclectic furniture arrangements, distinct themed zones.

segment_text: "Hell, sure. Next Saturday? We'll head over to Cabbagetown -- those old coach houses, you'd be amazed what people get rid of. It's practically criminal."
scene_description: Indoors, vast warehouse, eclectic furniture arrangements, distinct themed zones.

segment_text: "I would like to go with you on next Saturday very much Mr Jerry Abington." He used to talk like that, without commas or question marks.
scene_description: Indoors, vast warehouse, eclectic furniture arrangements, distinct themed zones.

segment_text: Later, he got better, but then, it was all one big sentence.
scene_description: Indoors, vast warehouse, eclectic furniture arrangements, distinct themed zones.

segment_text: "Call me Jerry. It's a date, then. Tell you what, though: there's a Code you got to learn before we go out. The Craphound's Code."
scene_description: Indoors, vast warehouse, eclectic furniture arrangements, distinct themed zones.

segment_text: "What is a craphound?"
scene_description: Indoors, vast warehouse, eclectic furniture arrangements, distinct themed zones.

segment_text: "You're lookin' at one. You're one, too, unless I miss my guess. You'll get to know some of the local craphounds, you hang around with me long enough.
scene_description: Indoors, vast warehouse, eclectic furniture arrangements, distinct themed zones.

segment_text: They're the competition, but they're also your buddies, and there're certain rules we have."
scene_description: Indoors, vast warehouse, eclectic furniture arrangements, distinct themed zones.

segment_text: And then I explained to him all about how you never bid against a craphound at a yard-sale, how you get to know the other fellows' tastes, and when you see something they might like, you haul it out for them, and they'll do the same for you, and how you never buy something that another craphound might be looking for, if all you're buying it for is to sell it back to him.
scene_description: Indoors, vast warehouse, eclectic furniture arrangements, distinct themed zones.

segment_text: Just good form and common sense, really, but you'd be surprised how many amateurs just fail to make the jump to pro because they can't grasp it.
scene_description: Indoors, vast warehouse, eclectic furniture arrangements, distinct themed zones.

segment_text: There was a bunch of other stuff at the auction, other craphounds' weekend treasures.
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: This was high season, when the sun comes out and people start to clean out the cottage, the basement, the garage.
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: There were some collectors in the crowd, and a whole whack of antique and junk dealers, and a few pickers, and me, and Craphound.
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: I watched the bidding listlessly, waiting for my things to come up and sneaking out for smokes between lots.
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: Craphound never once looked at me or acknowledged my presence, and I became perversely obsessed with catching his eye, so I coughed and shifted and walked past him several times, until the auctioneer glared at me, and one of the attendants asked if I needed a throat lozenge.
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: My lot came up. The bowling glasses went for five bucks to one of the Queen Street junk dealers; the elephant-foot fetched $350 after a spirited bidding war between an antique dealer and a collector -- the collector won; the dealer took the top-hat for $100.
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: The rest of it came up and sold, or didn't, and at end of the lot, I'd made over $800, which was rent for the month plus beer for the weekend plus gas for the truck.
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: Craphound bid on and bought more cowboy things -- a box of super-eight cowboy movies, the boxes mouldy, the stock itself running to slime; a Navajo blanket; a plastic donkey that dispensed cigarettes out of its ass; a big neon armadillo sign.
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: One of the other nice things about that place over Sotheby's, there was none of this waiting thirty days to get a cheque.
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: I queued up with the other pickers after the bidding was through, collected a wad of bills, and headed for my truck.
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: I spotted Craphound loading his haul into a minivan with handicapped plates.
scene_description: Outdoors, paved parking lot, parked minivan, dusk lighting.

segment_text: It looked like some kind of fungus was growing over the hood and side-panels. On closer inspection, I saw that the body had been covered in closely glued Lego.
scene_description: Outdoors, paved parking lot, parked minivan, dusk lighting.

segment_text: Craphound popped the hatchback and threw his gear in, then opened the driver's side door, and I saw that his van had been fitted out for a legless driver, with brake and accelerator levers.
scene_description: Outdoors, paved parking lot, parked minivan, dusk lighting.

segment_text: A paraplegic I knew drove one just like it.
scene_description: Outdoors, paved parking lot, parked minivan, dusk lighting.

segment_text: Craphound's exoskeleton levered him into the seat, and I watched the eerily precise way it executed the macro that started the car, pulled the shoulder-belt, put it into drive and switched on the stereo.
scene_description: Outdoors, paved parking lot, parked minivan, dusk lighting.

segment_text: I heard tape-hiss, then, loud as a b-boy cruising Yonge Street, an old-timey cowboy voice: "Howdy pardners! Saddle up, we're ridin'!"
scene_description: Outdoors, paved parking lot, parked minivan, dusk lighting.

segment_text: Then the van backed up and sped out of the lot.
scene_description: Outdoors, paved parking lot, parked minivan, dusk lighting.

segment_text: I get into the truck and drove home. Truth be told, I missed the little bastard.
scene_description: Indoors, living room, comfortable sofa, glowing television screen.

segment_text: Some people said that we should have run Craphound and his kin off the planet, out of the Solar System.
scene_description: Conceptual, abstract background, soft flowing colors, dreamy atmosphere.

segment_text: They said that it wasn't fair for the aliens to keep us in the dark about their technologies. They say that we should have captured a ship and reverse-engineered it, built our own and kicked ass.
scene_description: Conceptual, abstract background, soft flowing colors, dreamy atmosphere.

segment_text: Some people! First of all, nobody with human DNA could survive a trip in one of those ships.
scene_description: Conceptual, abstract background, soft flowing colors, dreamy atmosphere.

segment_text: They're part of Craphound's people's bodies, as I understand it, and we just don't have the right parts.
scene_description: Conceptual, abstract background, soft flowing colors, dreamy atmosphere.

segment_text: Second of all, they _were_ sharing their tech with us -- they just weren't giving it away. Fair trades every time.
scene_description: Conceptual, abstract background, soft flowing colors, dreamy atmosphere.

segment_text: It's not as if space was off-limits to us. We can any one of us visit their homeworld, just as soon as we figure out how.
scene_description: Conceptual, abstract background, soft flowing colors, dreamy atmosphere.

segment_text: Only they wouldn't hold our hands along the way.
scene_description: Conceptual, abstract background, soft flowing colors, dreamy atmosphere.

segment_text: I spent the week haunting the "Secret Boutique," AKA the Goodwill As-Is Centre on Jarvis.
scene_description: Indoors, thrift store, cluttered shelves, diverse used goods, checkout area.

segment_text: It's all there is to do between yard sales, and sometimes it makes for good finds.
scene_description: Indoors, thrift store, cluttered shelves, diverse used goods, checkout area.

segment_text: Part of my theory of yard-sale karma holds that if I miss one day at the thrift shops, that'll be the day they put out the big score.
scene_description: Indoors, thrift store, cluttered shelves, diverse used goods, checkout area.

segment_text: So I hit the stores diligently and came up with crapola. I had offended the fates, I knew, and wouldn't make another score until I placated them.
scene_description: Indoors, thrift store, cluttered shelves, diverse used goods, checkout area.

segment_text: It was lonely work, still and all, and I missed Craphound's good eye and obsessive delight.
scene_description: Indoors, thrift store, cluttered shelves, diverse used goods, checkout area.

segment_text: I was at the cash-register with a few items at the Goodwill when a guy in a suit behind me tapped me on the shoulder.
scene_description: Indoors, thrift store, cluttered shelves, diverse used goods, checkout area.

segment_text: "Sorry to bother you," he said. His suit looked expensive, as did his manicure and his haircut and his wire-rimmed glasses.
scene_description: Indoors, thrift store, cluttered shelves, diverse used goods, checkout area.

segment_text: "I was just wondering where you found that." He gestured at a rhinestone-studded ukelele, with a cowboy hat wood-burned into the body.
scene_description: Indoors, thrift store, cluttered shelves, diverse used goods, checkout area.

segment_text: I had picked it up with a guilty little thrill, thinking that Craphound might buy it at the next auction.
scene_description: Indoors, thrift store, cluttered shelves, diverse used goods, checkout area.

segment_text: "Second floor, in the toy section."
scene_description: Indoors, thrift store, cluttered shelves, diverse used goods, checkout area.

segment_text: "There wasn't anything else like it, was there?"
scene_description: Indoors, thrift store, cluttered shelves, diverse used goods, checkout area.

segment_text: "'Fraid not," I said, and the cashier picked it up and started wrapping it in newspaper.
scene_description: Indoors, thrift store, cluttered shelves, diverse used goods, checkout area.

segment_text: "Ah," he said, and he looked like a little kid who'd just been told that he couldn't have a puppy. "I don't suppose you'd want to sell it, would you?"
scene_description: Indoors, thrift store, cluttered shelves, diverse used goods, checkout area.

segment_text: I held up a hand and waited while the cashier bagged it with the rest of my stuff, a few old clothbound novels I thought I could sell at a used book-store, and a Grease belt-buckle with Olivia Newton John on it.
scene_description: Indoors, thrift store, cluttered shelves, diverse used goods, checkout area.

segment_text: I led him out the door by the elbow of his expensive suit.
scene_description: Outdoors, city sidewalk, store entrance, passing traffic, urban setting.

segment_text: "How much?" I had paid a dollar.
scene_description: Outdoors, city sidewalk, store entrance, passing traffic, urban setting.

segment_text: "Ten bucks?"
scene_description: Outdoors, city sidewalk, store entrance, passing traffic, urban setting.

segment_text: I nearly said, "Sold!" but I caught myself. "Twenty."
scene_description: Outdoors, city sidewalk, store entrance, passing traffic, urban setting.

segment_text: "Twenty dollars?"
scene_description: Outdoors, city sidewalk, store entrance, passing traffic, urban setting.

segment_text: "That's what they'd charge at a boutique on Queen Street." He took out a slim leather wallet and produced a twenty.
scene_description: Outdoors, city sidewalk, store entrance, passing traffic, urban setting.

segment_text: I handed him the uke. His face lit up like a lightbulb.
scene_description: Outdoors, city sidewalk, store entrance, passing traffic, urban setting.

segment_text: It's not that my adulthood is particularly unhappy. Likewise, it's not that my childhood was particularly happy.
scene_description: Conceptual, abstract background, soft flowing colors, dreamy atmosphere.

segment_text: There are memories I have, though, that are like a cool drink of water.
scene_description: Conceptual, abstract background, soft flowing colors, dreamy atmosphere.

segment_text: My grandfather's place near Milton, an old Victorian farmhouse, where the cat drank out of a milk-glass bowl; and where we sat around a rough pine table as big as my whole apartment; and where my playroom was the draughty barn with hay-filled lofts bulging with farm junk and Tarzan-ropes.
scene_description: Indoors, old barn loft, hay bales, scattered farm junk, wooden beams.

segment_text: There was Grampa's friend Fyodor, and we spent every evening at his wrecking-yard, he and Grampa talking and smoking while I scampered in the twilight, scaling mountains of auto-junk.
scene_description: Outdoors, junkyard, stacked rusted cars, twilight glow, industrial debris.

segment_text: The glove-boxes yielded treasures: crumpled photos of college boys mugging in front of signs, roadmaps of far-away places.
scene_description: Outdoors, junkyard, stacked rusted cars, twilight glow, industrial debris.

segment_text: I found a guidebook from the 1964 New York World's Fair once, and a lipstick like a chrome bullet, and a pair of white leather ladies' gloves.
scene_description: Outdoors, junkyard, stacked rusted cars, twilight glow, industrial debris.

segment_text: Fyodor dealt in scrap, too, and once, he had half of a carny carousel, a few horses and part of the canopy, paint flaking and sharp torn edges protruding; next to it, a Korean-war tank minus its turret and treads, and inside the tank were peeling old pinup girls and a rotation schedule and a crude Kilroy.
scene_description: Outdoors, junkyard, stacked rusted cars, twilight glow, industrial debris.

segment_text: The control-room in the middle of the carousel had a stack of paperback sci-fi novels, Ace Doubles that had two books bound back-to-back, and when you finished the first, you turned it over and read the other.
scene_description: Outdoors, junkyard, stacked rusted cars, twilight glow, industrial debris.

segment_text: Fyodor let me keep them, and there was a pawn-ticket in one from Macon, Georgia, for a transistor radio.
scene_description: Outdoors, junkyard, stacked rusted cars, twilight glow, industrial debris.

segment_text: My parents started leaving me alone when I was fourteen and I couldn't keep from sneaking into their room and snooping.
scene_description: Conceptual, abstract background, soft flowing colors, dreamy atmosphere.

segment_text: Mom's jewelry box had books of matches from their honeymoon in Acapulco, printed with bad palm-trees. My Dad kept an old photo in his sock drawer, of himself on muscle-beach, shirtless, flexing his biceps.
scene_description: Conceptual, abstract background, soft flowing colors, dreamy atmosphere.

segment_text: My grandmother saved every scrap of my mother's life in her basement, in dusty Army trunks.
scene_description: Conceptual, abstract background, soft flowing colors, dreamy atmosphere.

segment_text: I entertained myself by pulling it out and taking it in: her Mouse Ears from the big family train-trip to Disneyland in '57, and her records, and the glittery pasteboard sign from her sweet sixteen.
scene_description: Conceptual, abstract background, soft flowing colors, dreamy atmosphere.

segment_text: There were well-chewed stuffed animals, and school exercise books in which she'd practiced variations on her signature for page after page.
scene_description: Conceptual, abstract background, soft flowing colors, dreamy atmosphere.

segment_text: It all told a story. The penciled Kilroy in the tank made me see one of those Canadian soldiers in Korea, unshaven and crew-cut like an extra on M*A*S*H, sitting for bored hour after hour, staring at the pinup girls, fiddling with a crossword, finally laying it down and sketching his Kilroy quickly, before anyone saw.
scene_description: Conceptual, abstract background, soft flowing colors, dreamy atmosphere.

segment_text: The photo of my Dad posing sent me whirling through time to Toronto's Muscle Beach in the east end, and hearing the tinny AM radios playing weird psychedelic rock while teenagers lounged on their Mustangs and the girls sunbathed in bikinis that made their tits into torpedoes.
scene_description: Conceptual, abstract background, soft flowing colors, dreamy atmosphere.

segment_text: It all made poems. The old pulp novels and the pawn ticket, when I spread them out in front of the TV, and arranged them just so, they made up a poem that took my breath away.
scene_description: Conceptual, abstract background, soft flowing colors, dreamy atmosphere.

segment_text: After the cowboy trunk episode, I didn't run into Craphound again until the annual Rotary Club charity rummage sale at the Upper Canada Brewing Company.
scene_description: Outdoors, brewery grounds, sale tables, festive banners, crowds browsing.

segment_text: He was wearing the cowboy hat, sixguns and the silver star from the cowboy trunk.
scene_description: Outdoors, brewery grounds, sale tables, festive banners, crowds browsing.

segment_text: It should have looked ridiculous, but the net effect was naive and somehow charming, like he was a little boy whose hair you wanted to muss.
scene_description: Outdoors, brewery grounds, sale tables, festive banners, crowds browsing.

segment_text: I found a box of nice old melamine dishes, in various shades of green -- four square plates, bowls, salad-plates, and a serving tray.
scene_description: Outdoors, brewery grounds, sale tables, festive banners, crowds browsing.

segment_text: I threw them in the duffel-bag I'd brought and kept browsing, ignoring Craphound as he charmed a salty old Rotarian while fondling a box of leather-bound books.
scene_description: Outdoors, brewery grounds, sale tables, festive banners, crowds browsing.

segment_text: I browsed a stack of old Ministry of Labour licenses -- barber, chiropodist, bartender, watchmaker. They all had pretty seals and were framed in stark green institutional metal.
scene_description: Outdoors, brewery grounds, sale tables, festive banners, crowds browsing.

segment_text: They all had different names, but all from one family, and I made up a little story to entertain myself, about the proud mother saving her sons' accreditations and framing hanging them in the spare room with their diplomas.
scene_description: Outdoors, brewery grounds, sale tables, festive banners, crowds browsing.

segment_text: "Oh, George Junior's just opened his own barbershop, and little Jimmy's still fixing watches. . ." I bought them.
scene_description: Outdoors, brewery grounds, sale tables, festive banners, crowds browsing.

segment_text: In a box of crappy plastic Little Ponies and Barbies and Care Bears, I found a leather Indian headdress, a wooden bow-and-arrow set, and a fringed buckskin vest.
scene_description: Outdoors, brewery grounds, sale tables, festive banners, crowds browsing.

segment_text: Craphound was still buttering up the leather books' owner. I bought them quick, for five bucks.
scene_description: Outdoors, brewery grounds, sale tables, festive banners, crowds browsing.

segment_text: "Those are beautiful," a voice said at my elbow. I turned around and smiled at the snappy dresser who'd bought the uke at the Secret Boutique.
scene_description: Outdoors, brewery grounds, sale tables, festive banners, crowds browsing.

segment_text: He'd gone casual for the weekend, in an expensive, L.L. Bean button-down way.
scene_description: Outdoors, brewery grounds, sale tables, festive banners, crowds browsing.

segment_text: "Aren't they, though."
scene_description: Outdoors, brewery grounds, sale tables, festive banners, crowds browsing.

segment_text: "You sell them on Queen Street? Your finds, I mean?"
scene_description: Outdoors, brewery grounds, sale tables, festive banners, crowds browsing.

segment_text: "Sometimes. Sometimes at auction. How's the uke?"
scene_description: Outdoors, brewery grounds, sale tables, festive banners, crowds browsing.

segment_text: "Oh, I got it all tuned up," he said, and smiled the same smile he'd given me when he'd taken hold of it at Goodwill. "I can play 'Don't Fence Me In' on it."
scene_description: Outdoors, brewery grounds, sale tables, festive banners, crowds browsing.

segment_text: He looked at his feet. "Silly, huh?"
scene_description: Outdoors, brewery grounds, sale tables, festive banners, crowds browsing.

segment_text: "Not at all. You're into cowboy things, huh?" As I said it, I was overcome with the knowledge that this was "Billy the Kid," the original owner of the cowboy trunk.
scene_description: Outdoors, brewery grounds, sale tables, festive banners, crowds browsing.

segment_text: I don't know why I felt that way, but I did, with utter certainty.
scene_description: Outdoors, brewery grounds, sale tables, festive banners, crowds browsing.

segment_text: "Just trying to re-live a piece of my childhood, I guess. I'm Scott," he said, extending his hand.
scene_description: Outdoors, brewery grounds, sale tables, festive banners, crowds browsing.

segment_text: _Scott?_ I thought wildly. _Maybe it's his middle name?_ "I'm Jerry."
scene_description: Outdoors, brewery grounds, sale tables, festive banners, crowds browsing.

segment_text: The Upper Canada Brewery sale has many things going for it, including a beer garden where you can sample their wares and get a good BBQ burger.
scene_description: Outdoors, beer garden patio, wooden tables, beer cups, casual seating.

segment_text: We gently gravitated to it, looking over the tables as we went.
scene_description: Outdoors, beer garden patio, wooden tables, beer cups, casual seating.

segment_text: "You're a pro, right?" he asked after we had plastic cups of beer.
scene_description: Outdoors, beer garden patio, wooden tables, beer cups, casual seating.

segment_text: "You could say that."
scene_description: Outdoors, beer garden patio, wooden tables, beer cups, casual seating.

segment_text: "I'm an amateur. A rank amateur. Any words of wisdom?"
scene_description: Outdoors, beer garden patio, wooden tables, beer cups, casual seating.

segment_text: I laughed and drank some beer, lit a cigarette. "There's no secret to it, I think. Just diligence: you've got to go out every chance you get, or you'll miss the big score."
scene_description: Outdoors, beer garden patio, wooden tables, beer cups, casual seating.

segment_text: He chuckled. "I hear that. Sometimes, I'll be sitting in my office, and I'll just _know_ that they're putting out a piece of pure gold at the Goodwill and that someone else will get to it before my lunch.
scene_description: Outdoors, beer garden patio, wooden tables, beer cups, casual seating.

segment_text: I get so wound up, I'm no good until I go down there and hunt for it. I guess I'm hooked, eh?"
scene_description: Outdoors, beer garden patio, wooden tables, beer cups, casual seating.

segment_text: "Cheaper than some other kinds of addictions."
scene_description: Outdoors, beer garden patio, wooden tables, beer cups, casual seating.

segment_text: "I guess so. About that Indian stuff -- what do you figure you'd get for it at a Queen Street boutique?"
scene_description: Outdoors, beer garden patio, wooden tables, beer cups, casual seating.

segment_text: I looked him in the eye. He may have been something high-powered and cool and collected in his natural environment, but just then, he was as eager and nervous as a kitchen-table poker-player at a high-stakes game.
scene_description: Outdoors, beer garden patio, wooden tables, beer cups, casual seating.

segment_text: "Maybe fifty bucks," I said.
scene_description: Outdoors, beer garden patio, wooden tables, beer cups, casual seating.

segment_text: "Fifty, huh?" he asked.
scene_description: Outdoors, beer garden patio, wooden tables, beer cups, casual seating.

segment_text: "About that," I said.
scene_description: Outdoors, beer garden patio, wooden tables, beer cups, casual seating.

segment_text: "Once it sold," he said.
scene_description: Outdoors, beer garden patio, wooden tables, beer cups, casual seating.

segment_text: "There is that," I said.
scene_description: Outdoors, beer garden patio, wooden tables, beer cups, casual seating.

segment_text: "Might take a month, might take a year," he said.
scene_description: Outdoors, beer garden patio, wooden tables, beer cups, casual seating.

segment_text: "Might take a day," I said.
scene_description: Outdoors, beer garden patio, wooden tables, beer cups, casual seating.

segment_text: "It might, it might." He finished his beer. "I don't suppose you'd take forty?"
scene_description: Outdoors, beer garden patio, wooden tables, beer cups, casual seating.

segment_text: I'd paid five for it, not ten minutes before. It looked like it would fit Craphound, who, after all, was wearing Scott/Billy's own boyhood treasures as we spoke.
scene_description: Outdoors, beer garden patio, wooden tables, beer cups, casual seating.

segment_text: You don't make a living by feeling guilty over eight hundred percent markups. Still, I'd angered the fates, and needed to redeem myself.
scene_description: Outdoors, beer garden patio, wooden tables, beer cups, casual seating.

segment_text: "Make it five," I said.
scene_description: Outdoors, beer garden patio, wooden tables, beer cups, casual seating.

segment_text: He started to say something, then closed his mouth and gave me a look of thanks. He took a five out of his wallet and handed it to me.
scene_description: Outdoors, beer garden patio, wooden tables, beer cups, casual seating.

segment_text: I pulled the vest and bow and headdress out my duffel.
scene_description: Outdoors, beer garden patio, wooden tables, beer cups, casual seating.

segment_text: He walked back to a shiny black Jeep with gold detail work, parked next to Craphound's van.
scene_description: Outdoors, beer garden patio, wooden tables, beer cups, casual seating.

segment_text: Craphound was building onto the Lego body, and the hood had a miniature Lego town attached to it.
scene_description: Outdoors, beer garden patio, wooden tables, beer cups, casual seating.

segment_text: Craphound looked around as he passed, and leaned forward with undisguised interest at the booty. I grimaced and finished my beer.
scene_description: Outdoors, beer garden patio, wooden tables, beer cups, casual seating.

segment_text: I met Scott/Billy three times more at the Secret Boutique that week.
scene_description: Indoors, thrift store, cluttered shelves, diverse used goods, checkout area.

segment_text: He was a lawyer, who specialised in alien-technology patents. He had a practice on Bay Street, with two partners, and despite his youth, he was the senior man.
scene_description: Indoors, thrift store, cluttered shelves, diverse used goods, checkout area.

segment_text: I didn't let on that I knew about Billy the Kid and his mother in the East Muskoka Volunteer Fire Department Ladies' Auxiliary. But I felt a bond with him, as though we shared an unspoken secret.
scene_description: Indoors, thrift store, cluttered shelves, diverse used goods, checkout area.

segment_text: I pulled any cowboy finds for him, and he developed a pretty good eye for what I was after and returned the favour.
scene_description: Indoors, thrift store, cluttered shelves, diverse used goods, checkout area.

segment_text: The fates were with me again, and no two ways about it. I took home a ratty old Oriental rug that on closer inspection was a 19th century hand-knotted Persian; an upholstered Turkish footstool; a collection of hand-painted silk Hawaiiana pillows and a carved Meerschaum pipe.
scene_description: Indoors, thrift store, cluttered shelves, diverse used goods, checkout area.

segment_text: Scott/Billy found the last for me, and it cost me two dollars. I knew a collector who would pay thirty in an eye-blink, and from then on, as far as I was concerned, Scott/Billy was a fellow craphound.
scene_description: Indoors, thrift store, cluttered shelves, diverse used goods, checkout area.

segment_text: "You going to the auction tomorrow night?" I asked him at the checkout line.
scene_description: Indoors, thrift store, cluttered shelves, diverse used goods, checkout area.

segment_text: "Wouldn't miss it," he said. He'd barely been able to contain his excitement when I told him about the Thursday night auctions and the bargains to be had there.
scene_description: Indoors, thrift store, cluttered shelves, diverse used goods, checkout area.

segment_text: He sure had the bug.
scene_description: Indoors, thrift store, cluttered shelves, diverse used goods, checkout area.

segment_text: "Want to get together for dinner beforehand? The Rotterdam's got a good patio."
scene_description: Outdoors, restaurant patio, dining tables, ambient lighting, evening city.

segment_text: He did, and we did, and I had a glass of framboise that packed a hell of a kick and tasted like fizzy raspberry lemonade; and doorstopper fries and a club sandwich.
scene_description: Outdoors, restaurant patio, dining tables, ambient lighting, evening city.

segment_text: I had my nose in my glass when he kicked my ankle under the table. "Look at that!"
scene_description: Outdoors, restaurant patio, dining tables, ambient lighting, evening city.

segment_text: It was Craphound in his van, cruising for a parking spot.
scene_description: Outdoors, restaurant patio, dining tables, ambient lighting, evening city.

segment_text: The Lego village had been joined by a whole postmodern spaceport on the roof, with a red-and-blue
scene_description: Outdoors, restaurant patio, dining tables, ambient lighting, evening city.

segment_text: castle, a football-sized flying saucer, and a clown's head with blinking eyes. I went back to my drink and tried to get my appetite back.
scene_description: Outdoors, restaurant patio, dining tables, ambient lighting, evening city.

segment_text: "Was that an extee driving?" "Yeah. Used to be a friend of mine."
scene_description: Outdoors, restaurant patio, dining tables, ambient lighting, evening city.

segment_text: "He's a picker?" "Uh-huh." I turned back to my fries and tried to kill the subject.
scene_description: Outdoors, restaurant patio, dining tables, ambient lighting, evening city.

segment_text: "Do you know how he made his stake?" "The chlorophyll thing, in Saudi Arabia."
scene_description: Outdoors, restaurant patio, dining tables, ambient lighting, evening city.

segment_text: "Sweet!" he said. "Very sweet. I've got a client who's got some secondary patents from that one. What's he go after?"
scene_description: Outdoors, restaurant patio, dining tables, ambient lighting, evening city.

segment_text: "Oh, pretty much everything," I said, resigning myself to discussing the topic after all. "But lately, the same as you -- cowboys and Injuns."
scene_description: Outdoors, restaurant patio, dining tables, ambient lighting, evening city.

segment_text: He laughed and smacked his knee. "Well, what do you know? What could he possibly want with the stuff?"
scene_description: Outdoors, restaurant patio, dining tables, ambient lighting, evening city.

segment_text: "What do they want with any of it? He got started one day when we were cruising the Muskokas," I said carefully, watching his face. "Found a trunk of old cowboy things at a rummage sale. East Muskoka Volunteer Fire Department Ladies' Auxiliary."
scene_description: Outdoors, restaurant patio, dining tables, ambient lighting, evening city.

segment_text: I waited for him to shout or startle. He didn't. "Yeah? A good find, I guess. Wish I'd made it."
scene_description: Outdoors, restaurant patio, dining tables, ambient lighting, evening city.

segment_text: I didn't know what to say to that, so I took a bite of my sandwich.
scene_description: Outdoors, restaurant patio, dining tables, ambient lighting, evening city.

segment_text: Scott continued. "I think about what they get out of it a lot. There's nothing we have here that they couldn't make for themselves."
scene_description: Outdoors, restaurant patio, dining tables, ambient lighting, evening city.

segment_text: "I mean, if they picked up and left today, we'd still be making sense of everything they gave us in a hundred years. You know, I just closed a deal for a biochemical computer that's no-shit 10,000 times faster than anything we've built out of silicon."
scene_description: Outdoors, restaurant patio, dining tables, ambient lighting, evening city.

segment_text: "You know what the extee took in trade? Title to a defunct fairground outside of Calgary -- they shut it down ten years ago because the midway was too unsafe to ride."
scene_description: Outdoors, restaurant patio, dining tables, ambient lighting, evening city.

segment_text: "Doesn't that beat all? This thing is worth a billion dollars right out of the gate, I mean, within twenty-four hours of the deal closing, the seller can turn it into the GDP of Bolivia. For a crummy real-estate dog that you couldn't get five grand for!"
scene_description: Outdoors, restaurant patio, dining tables, ambient lighting, evening city.

segment_text: It always shocked me when Billy/Scott talked about his job -- it was easy to forget that he was a high-powered lawyer when we were jawing and fooling around like old craphounds.
scene_description: Outdoors, restaurant patio, dining tables, ambient lighting, evening city.

segment_text: I wondered if maybe he _wasn't_ Billy the Kid; I couldn't think of any reason for him to be playing it all so close to his chest.
scene_description: Outdoors, restaurant patio, dining tables, ambient lighting, evening city.

segment_text: "What the hell is some extee going to do with a fairground?"
scene_description: Outdoors, restaurant patio, dining tables, ambient lighting, evening city.

segment_text: Craphound got a free Coke from Lisa at the check-in when he made his appearance.
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: He bid high, but shrewdly, and never pulled ten-thousand-dollar stunts.
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: The bidders were wandering the floor, previewing that week's stock, and making notes to themselves.
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: I rooted through a box-lot full of old tins, and found one with a buckaroo at the Calgary Stampede, riding a bucking bronc. I picked it up and stood to inspect it.
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: Craphound was behind me.
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: "Nice piece, huh?" I said to him. "I like it very much," Craphound said, and I felt my cheeks flush.
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: "You're going to have some competition tonight, I think," I said, and nodded at Scott/Billy. "I think he's Billy; the one whose mother sold us -- you -- the cowboy trunk."
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: "Really?" Craphound said, and it felt like we were partners again, scoping out the competition.
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: Suddenly I felt a knife of shame, like I was betraying Scott/Billy somehow. I took a step back.
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: "Jerry, I am very sorry that we argued."
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: I sighed out a breath I hadn't known I was holding in. "Me, too."
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: "They're starting the bidding. May I sit with you?"
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: And so the three of us sat together, and Craphound shook Scott/Billy's hand and the auctioneer started into his harangue.
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: It was a night for unusual occurrences. I bid on a piece, something I told myself I'd never do.
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: It was a set of four matched Li'l Orphan Annie Ovaltine glasses, like Grandma's had been, and seeing them in the auctioneer's hand took me right back to her kitchen, and endless afternoons passed with my colouring books and weird old-lady hard candies and Liberace albums playing in the living room.
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: "Ten," I said, opening the bidding.
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: "I got ten, ten,ten, I got ten, who'll say twenty, who'll say twenty, twenty for the four."
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: Craphound waved his bidding card, and I jumped as if I'd been stung.
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: "I got twenty from the space cowboy, I got twenty, sir will you say thirty?"
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: I waved my card. "That's thirty to you sir."
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: "Forty," Craphound said.
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: "Fifty," I said even before the auctioneer could point back to me. An old pro, he settled back and let us do the work.
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: "One hundred," Craphound said.
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: "One fifty," I said.
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: The room was perfectly silent. I thought about my overextended MasterCard, and wondered if Scott/Billy would give me a loan.
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: "Two hundred," Craphound said.
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: Fine, I thought. Pay two hundred for those. I can get a set on Queen Street for thirty bucks.
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: The auctioneer turned to me. "The bidding stands at two. Will you say two-ten, sir?"
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: I shook my head.
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: The auctioneer paused a long moment, letting me sweat over the decision to bow out.
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: "I have two -- do I have any other bids from the floor? Any other bids? Sold, $200, to number 57."
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: An attendant brought Craphound the glasses. He took them and tucked them under his seat.
scene_description: Indoors, auction hall, rows of chairs, auctioneer's podium, displayed items.

segment_text: I was fuming when we left. Craphound was at my elbow.
scene_description: Outdoors, paved parking lot, parked minivan, dusk lighting.

segment_text: I wanted to punch him -- I'd never punched anyone in my life, but I wanted to punch him.
scene_description: Outdoors, paved parking lot, parked minivan, dusk lighting.

segment_text: We entered the cool night air and I sucked in several lungfuls before lighting a cigarette.
scene_description: Outdoors, paved parking lot, parked minivan, dusk lighting.

segment_text: "Jerry," Craphound said.
scene_description: Outdoors, paved parking lot, parked minivan, dusk lighting.

segment_text: I stopped, but didn't look at him. I watched the taxis pull in and out of the garage next door instead.
scene_description: Outdoors, paved parking lot, parked minivan, dusk lighting.

segment_text: "Jerry, my friend," Craphound said.
scene_description: Outdoors, paved parking lot, parked minivan, dusk lighting.

segment_text: "_What_?" I said, loud enough to startle myself. Scott, beside me, jerked as well.
scene_description: Outdoors, paved parking lot, parked minivan, dusk lighting.

segment_text: "We're going. I wanted to say goodbye, and to give you some things that I won't be taking with me."
scene_description: Outdoors, paved parking lot, parked minivan, dusk lighting.

segment_text: "What?" I said again, Scott just a beat behind me.
scene_description: Outdoors, paved parking lot, parked minivan, dusk lighting.

segment_text: "My people -- we're going. It has been decided. We've gotten what we came for."
scene_description: Outdoors, paved parking lot, parked minivan, dusk lighting.

segment_text: Without another word, he set off towards his van. We followed along behind, shell-shocked.
scene_description: Outdoors, paved parking lot, parked minivan, dusk lighting.

segment_text: Craphound's exoskeleton executed another macro and slid the panel-door aside, revealing the cowboy trunk.
scene_description: Outdoors, paved parking lot, parked minivan, dusk lighting.

segment_text: "I wanted to give you this. I will keep the glasses."
scene_description: Outdoors, paved parking lot, parked minivan, dusk lighting.

segment_text: "I don't understand," I said.
scene_description: Outdoors, paved parking lot, parked minivan, dusk lighting.

segment_text: "You're all leaving?" Scott asked, with a note of urgency.
scene_description: Outdoors, paved parking lot, parked minivan, dusk lighting.

segment_text: "It has been decided. We'll go over the next twenty-four hours."
scene_description: Outdoors, paved parking lot, parked minivan, dusk lighting.

segment_text: "But _why_?" Scott said, sounding almost petulant.
scene_description: Outdoors, paved parking lot, parked minivan, dusk lighting.

segment_text: "It's not something that I can easily explain. As you must know, the things we gave you were trinkets to us -- almost worthless. We traded them for something that was almost worthless to you -- a fair trade, you'll agree -- but it's time to move on."
scene_description: Outdoors, paved parking lot, parked minivan, dusk lighting.

segment_text: Craphound handed me the cowboy trunk.
scene_description: Outdoors, paved parking lot, parked minivan, dusk lighting.

segment_text: Holding it, I smelled the lubricant from his exoskeleton and the smell of the attic it had been mummified in before making its way into his hands. I felt like I almost understood.
scene_description: Outdoors, paved parking lot, parked minivan, dusk lighting.

segment_text: "This is for me," I said slowly, and Craphound nodded encouragingly. "This is for me, and you're keeping the glasses. And I'll look at this and feel. . ."
scene_description: Outdoors, paved parking lot, parked minivan, dusk lighting.

segment_text: "You understand," Craphound said, looking somehow relieved.
scene_description: Outdoors, paved parking lot, parked minivan, dusk lighting.

segment_text: And I _did_. I understood that an alien wearing a cowboy hat and sixguns and giving them away was a poem and a story, and a thirtyish bachelor trying to spend half a month's rent on four glasses so that he could remember his Grandma's kitchen was a story and a poem, and that the disused fairground outside Calgary was a story and a poem, too.
scene_description: Outdoors, paved parking lot, parked minivan, dusk lighting.

segment_text: "You're craphounds!" I said. "All of you!"
scene_description: Outdoors, paved parking lot, parked minivan, dusk lighting.

segment_text: Craphound smiled so I could see his gums and I put down the cowboy trunk and clapped my hands.
scene_description: Outdoors, paved parking lot, parked minivan, dusk lighting.

segment_text: Scott recovered from his shock by spending the night at his office, crunching numbers talking on the phone, and generally getting while the getting was good.
scene_description: Indoors, office interior, desk with phone, nighttime window view.

segment_text: He had an edge -- no one else knew that they were going.
scene_description: Indoors, office interior, desk with phone, nighttime window view.

segment_text: He went pro later that week, opened a chi-chi boutique on Queen Street, and hired me on as chief picker and factum factotum.
scene_description: Indoors, boutique shop window, mannequin display, street view background.

segment_text: Scott was not Billy the Kid. Just another Bay Street shyster with a cowboy jones.
scene_description: Indoors, boutique shop window, mannequin display, street view background.

segment_text: From the way they come down and spend, there must be a million of them.
scene_description: Indoors, boutique shop window, mannequin display, street view background.

segment_text: Our draw in the window is a beautiful mannequin I found, straight out of the Fifties, a little boy we call The Beaver.
scene_description: Indoors, boutique shop window, mannequin display, street view background.

segment_text: He dresses in chaps and a Sheriff's badge and sixguns and a miniature Stetson and cowboy boots with worn spurs, and rests one foot on a beautiful miniature steamer trunk whose leather is worked with cowboy motifs.
scene_description: Indoors, boutique shop window, mannequin display, street view background.

segment_text: He's not for sale at any price.
scene_description: Indoors, boutique shop window, mannequin display, street view background.
